word.literal: someone doing something in place of someone

sentence.idiomatic: I heard that he got someone to take his Level Four English exam for him.

word.literal: someone doing something in place of someone

sentence.idiomatic: This time the regulations in the exam hall are really strict, I'm afraid it won't be possible to get someone to write the exam for me.

sentence.idiomatic: He is a professional exam-taker. He specializes in taking physical education exams for other people.

I don't want to play. Do you know how to quit the game?

I said a sentence incorrectly, fortunately no one else caught it.

Good thing you reminded me, otherwise I would haven forgotten to bring my passport again.

Beijing's cost of living has pretty much caught up with Shanghai's.
He can't even do such an easy question; he really doesn't have any proficiency in this.
If I had attended Beijing University way back then, who knows how things would have been now.

Without your encouragement I definitely would have given up a long time ago.

You are so naive. As if anywhere in the world such a great thing would happen.

Playing games is a real waste of time.

My youth has gone like a bird, never to return.
